Package rig.Utils

Class ImageGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • rig.Utils.ImageGenerator
  • public class ImageGenerator
extends Object
    Generates and writes a PNG image to disk.
    Contains most of the logic for generating PNG image data. Supports a couple different generation modes as well.
    Author:
    vapsolon

    • Constructor Summary

      ImageGenerator​(int w, int h, int m, int v, boolean a)
      Public constructor for the class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageGenerator

        public ImageGenerator​(int w,
                      int h,
                      int m,
                      int v,
                      boolean a)
        Public constructor for the class.
        Takes the width and the height of the image, the image generation mode and the alpha flag as arguments and initializes all the required streams and the CRC-calculator in preparation for actual use.
        Parameters:
        w - Width of the image to be generated
        h - Height of the image to be generated
        m - Image generation mode
        v - Amount of variation for generation mode 2
        a - Whether alpha values are randomly generated or not

    • Method Detail

      • magic

        public byte[] magic()
        Returns the PNG magic header.
        Also includes the length of the immediately preceding "IHDR" block. The magic header will always be the same so it can be safely hardcoded.
        Returns:
        The hardcoded magic header

      • header

        public byte[] header()
        Returns the hardcoded IHDR data.
        Similarly to magic(), this returns the hardcoded part of the PNG IHDR block. Some of these values may end up becoming editable as support for different generation methods gets slowly added, but for now simply returning the hardcoded optimal set of values works.
        Returns:
        The hardcoded part of the PNG IHDR block

      • getCRCValue

        public long getCRCValue()
        Returns the CRC calculator's current value.
        Currently purely for testing purposes. The simplest way so far to test the writers of this class is writing data and comparing this generated CRC value to a pre-calculated one to see if the data was written correctly.
        Returns:
        The current CRC value

      • writeWord

        public void writeWord​(int i)
               throws IOException
        Helper method for writing a DWORD from an Integer.
        Takes an Integer value and makes a big-endian DWORD out of it. PNG wants its data to be big-endian, so some shifting is also required.
        Parameters:
        i - Integer value to be written into the file
        Throws:
        IOException - IOException

      • writeInt

        public void writeInt​(int i)
              throws IOException
        Helper method for writing a Byte from an Integer.
        Similar to writeWord() except with the end result being a single Byte instead of a DWORD this time.
        Parameters:
        i - Integer value to be written into the file
        Throws:
        IOException - IOException

      • write

        public void write​(byte[] b)
           throws IOException
        The actual main method for writing data into the output file.
        Takes byte-form data and writes it into the output file buffer. Also in charge of keeping the CRC updated with the data that's being written.
        Parameters:
        b - Bytearray to be written into the file
        Throws:
        IOException - IOException

      • generate

        public void generate()
              throws IOException
        Main image generation function.
        Where the magic happens. Generates a fresh PNG image from scratch.
        Starts off by writing in the magic file header and the IHDR block, both of which are mostly static. Once the prepwork is done the function then starts generating image data. Once the image data is generated it's written to the file along with the IEND block and the file is closed.
        Throws:
        IOException - IOException

      • genPixel

        public int[] genPixel()
        Randomly generates the colour values for an individual pixel.
        With more methods of generation being supported, pixel generation itself now gets its own function. Checks the generation mode the generator has been given and generates pixels with the correct colour values/range.
        Returns:
        int[] containing 4 values matching the R, G, B and A data of a single pixel
